H0.text: It will show people that storms can be prevented by scientists developing new satellite technology to help predict the weather.

H1.text: It will show people that science is interesting, as scientists develop new satellite technology to help predict the weather.

H2.text: It will help warn people about dangerous storms by enabling more accurate weather predictions through the new satellite technology scientists are developing.

H3.text: It will help people drive in the rain is how scientists developing new satellite technology to predict the weather will most likely benefit people.

A4.text: It can detect potentially dangerous weather such as solar wind and geomagnetic storms.

A5.text: Infrared satellite imagery can be used effectively for tropical cyclones with a visible eye pattern, using the Dvorak technique, where the difference between the temperature of the warm eye and the surrounding cold cloud tops can be used to determine its intensity (colder cloud tops generally indicate a more intense storm).
